attributes.description:
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.
attributes.header: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice pending replacement.
attributes.short_header: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice.

attributes.description:
Fare-Free Commuter Rail Alternative:
Riders can use the Franklin/Foxboro, Needham, or Providence/Stoughton Lines fare-free for service between Forest Hills, Ruggles, Back Bay and South Station. Regular fares will apply to travel beyond Forest Hills.

Accessible Service:
Accessible vans will be available, as needed, between North Station and Back Bay. Please see station personnel for assistance.

Travel Time:
Riders using shuttles should allow for ample extra travel time. For example, a rider travelling to Downtown Crossing from Forest Hills should budget at least an additional 30 minutes of travel time. 

Affected Orange Line Stations and Alternative Service:
North Station (Transfer within Station to Green Line) 
Haymarket (Transfer within Station to Green Line)

attributes.description:
-Construction and service updates for the Franklin/Foxboro, Providence/Stoughton, and Fairmount Lines will be provided as work progresses.

-Holiday service: On Thursday, November 27th, 2025 (Thanksgiving Day), Thursday, December 25th, 2025 (Christmas Day), Thursday, January 1st, 2026 (New Year’s Day), and Monday, February 16th, 2026 (President’s Day) all lines will operate on a weekend schedule. On Tuesday, November 11th, 2025 (Veterans' Day), Friday, November 28th, 2025 (Day after Thanksgiving), Monday, January 19th, 2026 (Martin Luther King Jr. Day), and Monday, April 20th, 2026 (Patriot’s Day), all lines will operate on a regular weekday schedule.

attributes.description:
Express Shuttles:
Shuttle buses will make all stops between Riverside and Newton Highlands and then run express to Copley.

Local Shuttles:
Shuttle buses will make all stops between Riverside and Kenmore except Beaconsfield. 

Accessible Van:
A van will be able to take riders between Beaconsfield, Dean Rd, Washington Sq & Reservoir stations.

Travel Time:
Riders using shuttles should allow for ample extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to Government Center from Riverside should budget at least an additional 30 – 45 minutes.

Free Bluebikes Access:
During this closure, the City of Boston is offering a promotion code for up to five free Bluebikes unlocks, MBTAGREEN1024.

Shuttle Stop Locations:

Riverside:
Riverside Station

attributes.description: There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.
attributes.header: There is no accessible path connecting the inbound and outbound platforms at Wellesley Square Station. The existing path includes steep slopes and is long. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.
attributes.short_header: There is no accessible path connecting the inb. & outb. platforms at Wellesley Sq Sta. The existing path includes steep slopes & is long.

attributes.description:
Travel Time:
Riders using shuttle bus service should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to Park Street from Braintree should allow for at least 35 minutes of travel in addition to their regular commute.   

Commuter Rail Fare-Free Alternatives:
Riders are strongly encouraged to use the Fall River/New Bedford, Kingston, and Greenbush Commuter Rail lines for fare-free service between Braintree, Quincy Center, JFK/UMass (weekdays only), and South Station. Commuter Rail schedules are available at mbta.com/CR. Regular Commuter Rail fares will be collected for travel beyond Braintree.

attributes.description:
The elevator will be closed for work that will significantly improve its long-term reliability.

To Exit:
Take an Oak Grove Train to Downtown Crossing; then take Downtown Crossing elevator 891 to Franklin Street. At Franklin Street customers should turn left and travel 450 feet south on Washington Street then take Downtown Crossing elevator 892 to the Forest Hills platform. Then take a Forest Hills Train to Chinatown and use elevator 922 to exit the station.

To Board:
Go to Chinatown Elevator 922 on Essex St. Take Elevator 922 to the Forest Hills platform. Take a Forest Hills train to Tufts Medical Center. Transfer to an Oak Grove train.

attributes.description:
C Branch eastbound service will be terminating at Kenmore. Riders can take any westbound B or D Branch train to Kenmore to board a train towards Cleveland Circle. 

Travel Time:
Riders using the shuttles buses should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to Park St from Medford/Tufts should add at least an additional 45 minutes of travel in additional to their regular commute.     

Accessibility Information:
Accessible van service will be available at Magoun Square. Riders can request this service by seeing onsite personnel.        MBTA buses that service Union Sq. are accessible.

Union Square Bus Alternatives:
Route 87 riders can connect to shuttles at Lechmere.
Route 91 riders can connect to shuttles at East Somerville, the Red Line at Central, or the Orange Line at Sullivan Square. 
Route 109 riders can connect to shuttles at East Somerville, the Red Line at Harvard, or the Orange Line at Sullivan Square. 

Free Bluebikes Access:
During this closure, the City of Boston is offering a promotion code for up to five free Bluebikes unlocks, MBTAGREEN114. After 30 minutes, a charge of $0.25/minute will be applied.

Shuttle stops:

Medford/Tufts:
College Ave @ Boston Ave

Ball Square:
Northbound - Ball Sq Station (Boston Ave @ Broadway)
Southbound - Ball Sq Station (Broadway @ Boston Ave)
 
Magoun Square:
Northbound - 525 Medford St (Medford St @ Broadway)
Southbound - 532 Medford St (Medford St @ Broadway)

Gilman Square:
Northbound & Southbound - Medford St @ School St

East Somerville:
Northbound - McGrath Hwy @ Alston St
Southbound - Medford St @ Washington St

Union Square:
No shuttle buses. 

Lechmere:
Northbound & Southbound - Lechmere Busway

Science Park/West End:
Northbound - Nashua Street Park
Southbound - 6 Whittier Place (Martha Rd @ Whittier Place)

North Station:
Northbound - Nashua St @ Red Auerbach Way 

Subway Connections:
- North Station (Transfer within Station to Orange Line)
- Haymarket (Transfer within Station to Orange Line.)
- Government Center (use State, 0.2 mi.)
- Park Street (use the Winter St Concourse to Downtown Crossing, 0.2 mi.)
attributes.header: Green Line: No train service between Medford/Tufts, Union Sq., and Park St., from 8 PM on Nov 4, through Nov 13, for track work. Use shuttle buses between Medford/Tufts & North Station. Use the Orange Line downtown. Union Sq riders use Rt 87 to Lechmere
attributes.service_effect: Suspension of service on Green Line
attributes.short_header: Green Ln: No trains between Medford/Tufts, Union Sq., & Park St., from 8 PM on Nov 4, through Nov 13, for track work.

attributes.description:
Holiday service: 
On Thursday, November 27th, 2025 (Thanksgiving Day), Thursday, December 25th, 2025 (Christmas Day), Thursday, January 1st, 2026 (New Year’s Day), and Monday, February 16th, 2026 (President’s Day) all lines will operate on a weekend schedule.

 On Tuesday, November 11th, 2025 (Veterans' Day), Friday, November 28th, 2025 (Day after Thanksgiving), Monday, January 19th, 2026 (Martin Luther King Jr. Day), and Monday, April 20th, 2026 (Patriot’s Day), all lines will operate on a regular weekday schedule.
attributes.header: The new Fall/Winter Schedule will go into effect on Monday, October 27th with seasonal and on-time performance adjustments. The schedule for all lines are available on MBTA.com now and at Boston hub stations soon.
